conversation.text: Based on your preferences, I would recommend The Pianist (2002) as an alternative. This movie, directed by Steven Spielberg, tells the story of Władysław Szpilman, a Polish musician who lost his piano and music career after World War II. In order to make ends meet financially, he took up work as a taxi driver in Paris. While driving a taxi, he was shocked when he heard a radio broadcast about the end of World War II in Europe. He immediately rushed back to his apartment where his piano was stored. When he arrived at his apartment building, he noticed that there were many people gathered outside of the building. As he approached the group of people outside of the building, he noticed that there were several people who appeared to be very upset and distraught.
